Zeb Does Obsidian/Black Isle

Alpha Protocol: Team Mina

I‚Äôve been obsessively watching videos about Fallout 76 and that has meant delving down into the world of gaming YouTube and I‚Äôm telling you guys, some of these videos are so utterly cringe they cause me physical pain. Is this just what it‚Äôs like to consume other people‚Äôs video game content??? Is this the way that I make YOU feel?????? If it is then why have you let this farce go on for so long??????????

Lest I stare too long into the abyss of YouTube gaming and the self-reflection that arises from it, let‚Äôs talk about Alpha Protocol now. I really don‚Äôt have a whole lot to say, so we‚Äôll be keeping this post short and sweet. Spoilers follow, and a mention of sexual violence.

This is really just the story of one extremely boring man surrounded by a glimmering constellation of brilliant, deadly women, huh? The point is probably supposed to be that they can all be romanced, but Obsidian was kind enough to ensure that they are all fully-fledged, capable and interesting characters in their own right, and I more or less stopped paying attention to Mike altogether at some point to lavish my attentions on them.

Speaking of lavishing attentions, I did think the Mina romance was pretty dang cute, and I think they have a great dynamic together:

Mike: Now this is why I love you.

Mina: You can send roses to my dead drop in Prague.

Mike: Does the pope shit in the woods?

Mina: I really hope not.

Mike: Sorry, mixed metaphors.

The only regrettable thing about it was that I never got rid of Mike‚Äôs horrible scraggly beard, and I am truly sorry for Mina that she had to experience kissing that.

Steven Heck is 100% serving the absolutely unhinged chaotic energy that I try to channel every time I sit down to write a blog post (only slightly more homicidal) and I have to say the portion of the game featuring him was a true highlight:

Heck: Did you know a soccer ball can decapitate a man at 400 miles per hour?

The AI in this game is uhhhhhhh something you really must behold for yourself. At one point 5 enemies slowly clambered down a ladder one after another to be karate chopped to death at the bottom.

I accidentally chose SIE as my handler for the final mission and felt really uncomfortable with the scene where she talks to Mike while he‚Äôs restrained. She behaves very suggestively and almost kisses him, and the whole time I was thinking how unacceptable people would find a scene like that if their genders were reversed and it was a woman who was tied up and a man making a pass at her while she was restrained. It feels like it falls into that sexual double standard where men are supposed to interpret any sexual interest as a personal victory even if that interest is actually predatory and/or threatening. And you know what I have to say to that?

So overall‚Ä¶this is a really interesting one. Alpha Protocol‚Äòs strength is certainly the sheer intricacy of the story it tells, and the significant impact that player choices have on outcomes of all kinds. ‚ÄúMoral choices‚Äù is a buzzword (buzzphrase?) that gets tossed around in RPGs a lot, and I think this game delivers on that promise in a great way. The plot itself was perfectly enjoyable if not deeply engaging, and a number of the characters shone. As for gameplay, I got really tired of playing through stealth and playing through as a shooter because both systems were so janky and repetitive ‚Äì in short, combat was something of a repetitive chore. Overall, though, I‚Äôd say this game gets a 7/10 shitting popes.

And now for Dungeon Siege III! Otherwise known as a game I know literally nothing about! We‚Äôll see if it also takes me several months to complete‚Ä¶

Well, Boys, Here We Are Again With Alpha Protocol

It speaks volumes about my General Mental State that last night I had a nightmare where I downloaded the original Neverwinter Nights 2 Bishop Romance Mod and it was absolutely despicable and I was like ‚ÄúI fucking hate this but I‚Äôm doing it for my BLOG‚Äù and I refused to stop playing it. Psychoanalyze THAT, why don‚Äôt you?

So I started playing Mask of the Betrayer and I just really really wasn‚Äôt feeling it, so I‚Äôm gonna toss it onto the backburner for now. To Be Revisited when I‚Äôm back in the mood for D&D! For now, it‚Äôs SPY TIME! That actually makes this post sound a lot more fun than it is, because it mostly has to do with me being terrible at video games.

What you should know right off the bat is that I‚Äôve more or less entirely forgotten how to play a FPS game. This fact will suffice to explain the majority of what will follow in the rest of this post.

I got things off to a fucking excellent start, and I have some texts that preserve my incompetence in time forever like a dragonfly encased in amber:

Did I manage to finally make him look like a pervert? Well, you can answer that for yourself. It is my utmost pleasure to present to you Michael ‚ÄúDefinitely Not a Spy, Just a Normal Man‚Äù Thorton:

Yes, indeed, I DID play through the entirety of the game so far with him looking like this!

What‚Äôs excellent is that Thorton is genuinely the dumbest man in the world.

Scarlet: [holds up magazine article, next to which is an advertisement of a woman‚Äôs legs] Look at this!

Mike: Are those your legs?

Mike: I‚Äôm looking for a man. Not in that way.

Mike: *steps into the path of an oncoming train and is immediately reduced to smithereens*

Okay, that last one is just a reflection of me being dumb. Do you see what I‚Äôm saying, though? I have a strong suspicion that all of the suave/flirtatious dialogue choices are equally ridiculous, and I would take them at every opportunity were it not for my mortal fear of turning Thorton into an Actual Pervert. I can handle the aesthetic, not the true enactment!

I‚Äôm fucking stuck on the Brayko boss fight. And I mean STUCK. The first time I played through I was like ‚ÄúHuh, maybe I shouldn‚Äôt have exclusively specced for stealth. Well, shit.‚Äù So I tried and I tried and I eventually gave up and quit in a rage, and then I decided that I would start the game over again with a better-built character. It‚Äôs honestly the most genious brain thing I‚Äôve ever done because now I‚Äôm entirely sick of the game and I still can‚Äôt beat Brayko lmao!

Remember when I was playing Baldur‚Äôs Gate 2 and couldn‚Äôt defeat moon boy dweeb Rasaad‚Äôs final boss fight and consequently spiraled down into inane hateful anger and the depths of crushing despair? Yeah, a similar psychological process is happening now. I SWOM TO JOM GUYS, who would have thought that Alpha Protocol was going to be the game to make me have a mental breakdown this playthrough? I was sure it‚Äôd be South Park: the Stick of Truth!

Edit 10/30: well, the day after making this post I beat Brayko super easily so I think the solution to any hard boss fight is just to complain about it on the Internet. If you‚Äôre looking for actual tactics, though, I can help! I immediately ran to the left alcove to hide and then used my AR to winnow down his health to JUST before the cutscene triggers (when he reaches a certain health the cutscene triggers and the fight changes). Then I used chain shot and headshot him as many times as possible. This got him well below half health. When the other enemies came out I focused on avoiding/killing them until Brayko came downstairs and then I repeated the process: get rid of his shields with the AR and then chain shot. When he went into his stabby cocaine rage I ran and angled the camera so that I could see him, so when he stopped chasing and started cowering I knew right away. That‚Äôs when I was able to do the most damage to him besides the initial stage of the fight. This tactic took him down really fast. Good luck!

Please please PLEASE send me all your game-beatiest vibes! I need all the help I can get!!!!!!

Neverwinter Nights 2: Thick with Child

Today I was in the ABSOLUTE worst mood for absolutely no reason whatsoever; we‚Äôre talking actively glaring and stomping around and wanting to wreck shit, and then I decided to read through basically the entire backlog of this blog, and I emerged in a state of pure bliss.

With that out of the way, it‚Äôs time to return to Neverwinter Nights 2. Spoilers follow!

Although, to a critical eye, any post on this blog might constitute what the experts call a ‚Äúfuck up,‚Äù I‚Äôm sad to say that I REALLY AND TRULY did fuck up by apparently having a massive brain aneurysm and forgetting to talk about all of the end-game stuff with Bishop in the post entirely and completely dedicated to dunking on Bishop and Casavir. My bad!!!!!

So if you‚Äôre not familiar with the plot, Absolute Rat Bastard Bishop betrays your side to the King of Shadows and nopes the fuck out with some real classic lines for the ages:

Bishop: Stay on the walls ‚Äì you might live through this. For what it‚Äôs worth, you almost made me stick around, but that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm going to have to do this [‚Ä¶] I was thinking it would be as easy to hate you as I did Duncan but I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶at all. But see, that‚Äôs the reason it‚Äôs going to end like this. I‚Äôm not going to be tied to anyone or anything again.

Okay. So. SO. Just to reiterate? ‚ÄúI love you but I refuse to Have Feelings so I have to kill you‚Äù is REALLY the justification here. That‚Äôs SERIOUSLY what he‚Äôs going with.

There are also some definite undertones of ‚ÄúFuck you for not choosing me over Casavir‚Äù but‚Ä¶..but‚Ä¶‚Ä¶it‚Äôs not like Casavir fared any better, my dude!!! Rodiewen friendzoned him and made him carry 300 pounds of healing potions into the final battle!!!!!!

Just to confirm this suspicion: I was perusing this guide to figure out which companions will turn on you in this confrontation scene, and the walkthrough describes what happens if you romance Casavir (which I obviously did NOT do because I don‚Äôt actually hate myself that much):

Bishop: Don‚Äôt think I didn‚Äôt see you and the paladin here, right before the siege. And to think that before that I was willing to fight for you ‚Äì I would have died for you.

Deciding to betray your unrequited crush‚Äôs side in a war against all-consuming evil and actively plotting for her death is uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh pretty much well-off the ‚ÄúUnable to Handle Rejection‚Äù charts. Forget about Neckbeard Anders, this is like genuinely some incel levels of violent, vengeful batshit derangement over not getting fucked.

WOLFCEL

Okay, sorry, can I just remind you: someone looked at this and was like ‚ÄúHmmmm, let‚Äôs keep the jawline, wolf fetish and aggressive sociopathy, add just a little bit more explicit sexuality and drag n‚Äô drop this Whole Situation into the land of the Nords.‚Äù I CAN‚ÄôT FORGET THIS FACT SO YOU HAVE TO SUFFER WITH ME.

If you can look past the hordes (ok there are two but that‚Äôs two too many imo) of dogshit men who are inexplicably obsessed with your player character, the great news is that Neverwinter Nights 2 kind of sucks ass! My chief complaints are as follows: inconceivably bad camera controls, party controls and AI, boring combat and a positive plethora of bugs, glitches and crashes. I don‚Äôt usually spend that much time discussing things like this but I think that‚Äôs been because I haven‚Äôt really encountered a game where these components are as awful as they are in this game. They really, really are.

If you can look past the shambling technical state of the game, the great news is that NWN 2 has worse pacing than any game I‚Äôve ever played ‚Äì and may I remind you that I‚Äôve played Dragon Age II??? There is SO much boring, unnecessary shit in the first act especially ‚Äì like, how many errands do you have to run for the Neverwinter Guard before they let you into the Blacklake District?

If you can look past the significant parts of the game that are aimless, meandering fetch-questing, the great news is that the game forces you to spend vast quantities of time with a group of characters who seem, by and large, specifically designed to be as annoying and antagonistic as possible.

One of the things that I usually love about RPG companions is the sense of found family that emerges as the companions gradually bond with each other and overcome their differences. Unfortunately, I can‚Äôt think of a single instance of one companion in this game being anything approaching companionable or friendly towards another companion in this game. Everyone hates everyone, and it really, truly grates on the nerves after a while.

To be entirely fair, however, there were some truly funny moments amongst all the bickering and they are as follows:

Khelgar: Now don‚Äôt be bringing my mother into this! You‚Äôd best be careful, you simpering little father‚Äôs girl, or you‚Äôll learn a thing or two about Ironfist honor and manhood!

Qara: Oh, you mean the two smallest things in Faerun? From what I hear, no woman could learn about Ironfist manhood from you, Khelgar.

Deekin: I like gnomes, / So dumb and fat, / Fat and dumb / In burrows like moles / Shoot ‚Äôem full of arrows / Put ‚Äôem on a stick / That‚Äôs why I like gnomes.

Grobnar: My word. Just hearing that gives me the shivers‚Ä¶I say, this is‚Ä¶genius. The tone, the tempo. You can almost feel the angst and pain of the gnomes as they are filled with arrows‚Ä¶ and put on sticks. And the theme of the piece‚Ä¶ now, that is tragedy, in its deepest, most primal form. And the climax, the uplifting portion, where the affirmation of liking gnomes is confirmed‚Ä¶ And then brought full circle with the physical and emotional double meaning of them being in the mind and in the stomach. Amazing. I say, travelling to Neverwinter with you all has really been broadening my horizons ‚Äî who would have thought I‚Äôd get to meet a kobold author and playwright!

Credit where credit is due! The funniest character this game is Neeshka and she is an absolute delight. It also helps that I‚Äôm just such a sucker for the ‚Äúscampy disaster rogue girl‚Äù trope.

Neeshka *imitating Elanee*: This water is so unnatural and deep, unlike the swamp of dead people I grew up in!

Bishop: How many enemies do you have? There‚Äôs almost more than I can count.

Neeshka: There‚Äôs a surprise.

Bishop: Well then you‚Äôll be paying me another way. My bedroll‚Äôs a little cold at night ‚Äì I‚Äôm thinking you can fix that.

Neeshka: I could always set you on fire, Bishop. That‚Äôd solve two problems.

I know I already mentioned that one but it deserves to be mentioned again.

Trent Vendal: Look at this. An actual Watchman on patrol.

Neeshka: What? Wh-?

Khelgar Ironfist: He means us, girl.

Neeshka: Oh, Gods, I keep forgetting.

Also she fucking BREAKS A GEAS because she loves your character so much:

Neeshka: I can‚Äôt! I won‚Äôt betray the only person who ever showed me kindness!

WE STAN A TIEFLING QUEEN.

We‚Äôre rapidly tumbling downhill into the part of the post where I enter some kind of fugue state and just start to ramble derangedly. So I had to take like 5 screenshots of this absolutely haunting portrait of a man because I kept forgetting about it and screenshotting over them:

Isn‚Äôt it something? Now that thousands (!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) of people have read this blog I‚Äôm gonna set up a Patreon and use the proceeds to commission an oil painter to create a life size replica of this painting. It‚Äôs gonna be a giant scandal and it‚Äôs gonna be great.

Charlotte: [has Rodiewen start stealing items from a shop in broad daylight, right after the elderly owner was threatened by thugs and forced to witness a bloodbath]

NWN2: Your alignment has shifted one point towards evil.

Charlotte:

Me @ me:

I will not be dissuaded of my conviction that someone at Obsidian was tasked with the job of coming up with the most disgusting way of describing pregnancy possible because at one point Dhaegun describes Rodiewen‚Äôs mother as being (brace yourself) ‚ÄúTHICK WITH CHILD‚Äù. I‚Äôm not even one of those people who thinks pregnancy is automatically body horror or whatever, and I HATE IT SO MUCH.

Besides Neeshka, my favorite characters in the game were the adorable little kobald bard-turned-merchant Deekin (from the Neverwinter Nights expansions) and Kiriel the giant spider who, when befriended as opposed to killed, takes up residence in the dungeons of your Keep. ‚ù§ ‚ù§ ‚ù§ I‚Äôm actually thinking I might go back and play the NWN expansions just for Deekin!

At one point Rodiewen is talking to Grobnar about his hopeless pursuit of an elusive mythical being named the Wendersnaven, and she has the option of saying the following:

Rodiewen: I want to believe.

SO. As you may be able to tell, this game is a hot mess. But by now you should know that I have a terrible soft spot for the scrappy underdog entries of vastly popular RPG franchises (hello, DA2 and Oblivion). I care for those games infinitely more than I care for this one, but it still kind of charmed me in its own disastrous way. In some ways it feels like a very VERY rough prototype for Dragon Age: Origins, so if you‚Äôve played that game for the millionth time and you‚Äôre looking for something to scratch the same itch you might want to check this game out. Just‚Ä¶.be prepared. 6.5/10 Wendersnavens. In 3 words: Fuck those dudes.

But but but! I‚Äôm not through with Neverwinter Nights 2 yet; I‚Äôm still going to play the expansion Mask of the Betrayer because it‚Äôs supposed to be amazing. We‚Äôll see‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

Neverwinter Nights 2: Breaking Dawn

I have two (2) pieces of housekeeping news.

1. It is with the utmost shame and chagrin that I tell you, my beloved reader, that I have failed in my most sacred duty as a blogger: informing you of my 69th blog post. It came and it went and I was derelict, wanton, careless of its passage. All I can offer you now as compensation after the fact is that I couldn‚Äôt remember how to spell derelict and almost auto-corrected it to ‚Äúerectile.‚Äù I hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me, and if someone hasn‚Äôt hired a sniper to take me out and end this debacle before blog post 420 (!!!!!), you know I‚Äôll do better next time.

2. To every person (and there have been a few) who has written me an angry essay about how I‚Äôm actually just a huge bitch for not liking the Skyrim Romance Mod:

The day is coming when I make a post that‚Äôs just Emperor Palpatine‚Äôs face.

Anyways, let‚Äôs talk about Neverwinter Nights 2. I finally fucking finished it, for starters! I unfortunately have a WHOLE POST‚ÄôS WORTH of nonsense to spew about the disaster of a love triangle that is featured in this game so if you‚Äôre, like, actually interested in the plot of the game or some such shit that‚Äôll be the next post. Also, in light of the‚Ä¶enthusiastic responses that I‚Äôve gotten about the Skyrim post, I just want to assure you that the anger that I manufacture here is exaggerated for comedic purposes!!!!! I promise!!!! Let‚Äôs get to it!

For the longest time this was the only thing in my draft for this post:

Because I innately sensed with every fiber of my being that my poor character (her name is Rodiewen, which is a really really stupid name but I‚Äôve named like 500 characters now and they can‚Äôt all be winners) was going to get shoe-horned into the middle of some godforsaken motherfucking love triangle between Casavir The World‚Äôs Most Boring Man and Bishop the LITERAL sociopath.

Here‚Äôs the thing about love triangles: the only good one is The Age of Innocence by Edith Wharton and the rest of them are garb√†ge. If you‚Äôre going to pull it off the romantic choices should meaningfully represent different ideologies or otherwise reflect on the main character‚Äôs overarching internal struggle in some way, but nobody does that!! 99% of the time it‚Äôs just like‚Ä¶‚Ä¶Oh no, how will Mary Sue choose between Alpha Bad Boy with a Secret Soft Side and White Bread Boy Next Door Who She Treats Like a Pet Dog? With that in mind, let‚Äôs talk about Bishop and Casavir lol.

I spent some time Hate-Googling phrases like ‚ÄúCasavir is boring‚Äù and ‚ÄúCasavir is the worst companion‚Äù just to validate my feelings about him, and here are some of my favorite results from that Googling. First of all, there‚Äôs this companion popularity poll in which Casavir is the only companion with ZERO VOTES:

I also found this forum discussion, in which user PrincessPurpleBlob writes the following (terrifyingly astute) description of him: ‚Äúhi‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm casavir and I‚Äôm obsessed with Old Owl Well. I also hate bishop‚Ä¶ oh, did I tell you that I want to protect you?‚Äú

He is without a doubt the most aggressively self-important, pompous and bland character I‚Äôve ever encountered in my life. He‚Äôs plain tofu, rice cakes and khaki pants as a human being. He‚Äôs Cullen on steroids. He‚Äôs also an overbearing gentlesir and a giant hypocrite. He‚Äôs CONSTANTLY all like ‚Äúhurr durr m‚Äôlady I must protect you from the bad bad man‚Äù like Rodiewen‚Äôs not an unstoppable machine of death and also an autonomous grown woman capable of assessing her own risks and making her own choices. The hypocrisy comes in when he tries to act like all the helicopter-paladining about Bishop is just out of moralistic righteousness but it‚Äôs obvious that it‚Äôs just because he‚Äôs 1) into Rodiewen and 2) threatened by Bishop‚Äôs interest in her and 3) trying to control who she interacts with because he can‚Äôt handle his own personal insecurity.

When he‚Äôs confessing his love the game gives you the option of saying ‚ÄúWhy are you doing this?‚Äù and I have never related to a piece of in-game dialogue more in my life.

Like seriously, me @ Casavir every time he opens his stupid goddamned mouth:

The single interesting thing about this love triangle is that Bishop consistently points out Casavir‚Äôs overbearing hypocrisy and challenges him to let Rodiewen speak for herself instead of cutting in and speaking over her. Hmmmmm. HMMMMMM. But! Before you start thinking Bishop‚Äôs the better choice, let‚Äôs do talk about the original Mr. Savage Wolf himself.

To be completely fair, he‚Äôs 7000% more tolerable than his sexually-assaulting, abusive bastardization in Skyrim Romance, but he‚Äôs still an absolute fuck-knuckle. He‚Äôs totally one of those social Darwinist edgelord motherfuckers who‚Äôs like ‚ÄúOh I‚Äôm not racist, I hate everyone equally >:)‚Äù and it blooooooooows.

He‚Äôs also one of those dudes who thinks that being an asshole makes him interesting so he just goes around saying the edgiest things he can possibly think of under the impression that it gives him the semblance of a personality. While Rodiewen and Elanee are discussing tactics together, this is how he offers to help:

Bishop: I thought I heard the cries of a damsel in distress. Someone has to take up Shandra‚Äôs usual role, it seems.

This is right after Shandra has died sacrificing herself for the group‚Äôs survival, mind you. Am I wrong in sensing that he‚Äôs like 0.5 milliseconds away from saying ‚Äúlol triggered??‚Äù at any given point in time?

However, the amazing thing about Bishop is every female character‚Äôs absolute intolerance for his skeezy bullshit:

Bishop: Well then you‚Äôll be paying me another way. My bedroll‚Äôs a little cold at night ‚Äì I‚Äôm thinking you can fix that.

Neeshka: I could always set you on fire, Bishop. That‚Äôd solve two problems.

Bishop: [didn‚Äôt screenshot, sorry] The way to resolve your problems is clearly to run away and ‚Äúgo‚Äù ‚Äúcamping‚Äù with me, a psychopathic bastard man who you‚Äôve known for like three in-game days. This is a normal thing to suggest.

Rodiewen: I‚Äôd rather stab myself in the throat.

Lmao anyways they‚Äôre both fucking dead now so that‚Äôs the end of that. THAT was a pretty bold move on Obsidian‚Äôs part, gotta say!!!!!!!

According to TV Tropes, Chris Avellone prefers writing ‚Äúromances that end poorly‚Äù to traditional romances, and I think this whole‚Ä¶‚Ä¶situation could definitely be understood from that perspective. It‚Äôs also really strongly reminiscent of the Atton/Disciple stuff in KOTOR 2 as well as Annah/Fall-From-Grace in Planescape: Torment: one character is chaotic, cynical and dodgy while the other is excessively lawful, moralistic and contained and while they both like your character there is very little content that could actually be construed as a full-fledged romance beyond their jealous rivalry.

It‚Äôs a much less compartmentalized approach to writing attraction than what you typically see in a BioWare game, for instance. With the exception of Anders, I can‚Äôt really think of any BioWare characters who continue to overtly and persistently crush on your character when you have not indicated interest in them too. I think there are pros and cons to both styles: the former feels more organic and realistic, but I like that the latter gives you the choice to opt in or opt out as opposed to forcing you to experience romantic attention when you‚Äôre not interested in it.

Because honestly, this is more or less how it went in this game:

Obsidian: Here‚Äôs a couple of guys to tell your female player character that she‚Äôs beautiful and fight for her love! Compliments and male attention are integral parts of this wish-fulfillment power fantasy we are crafting for you! üôÇ

Charlotte:

Hey, you know what? The other thing about love triangles is that all the waffling back and forth and hand-wringing could be solved by a good old-fashioned m√©nage √† trois if anyone involved had a since ounce of creativity. ON THAT NOTE, stay tuned for my upcoming Neverwinter Nights 2 fanfiction post!!!!!!!! (I JEST. IN CASE YOU WEREN‚ÄôT SURE.)

My final bullet point today is that talking so much about love triangles made me think about Twilight: Breaking Dawn and then that made me think about this again:

It‚Äôs very important.

Well, that‚Äôs that. Another day, another cathartic rant about the toxic mores of socialized masculinity as embodied in sundry video game creations.

KOTOR 2: Bao-Dur ASMR and My 7,000 Feelings About Kreia

Welcome to KOTOR II part 2: the part that isn‚Äôt exclusively about C*rth and my all-consuming enmity towards him. You know there‚Äôs gonna be all kinds of spoilies!!

If I‚Äôm remembering KOTOR correctly there is a fair bit less character interaction in this game than the first game, with fewer conversations and no personal quests. While there are banters upon entering the Ebon Hawk and opportunities to turn your companions into Jedi, these don‚Äôt quite make up the difference. There are a few standout moments that I‚Äôd still like to address.

Exile: Do you understand men?

Mira: That‚Äôs why I dress like this. When they‚Äôre looking down to check you out, you can usually smash them on the base of the skull, or deliver an uppercut that knocks them flat. It‚Äôs simple- when you want a man, you jab him with a Bothun stunner, then while he‚Äôs screaming in pain you slap some stun cuffs on him. Then starve him for two or three days until he becomes open to suggestion, then double check his bounty and see if he‚Äôs worth anything.

I mean, okay, so this bitch Atton is stuck in a prison cell and a lady comes in to rescue him, and his genious brain immediately fires off this absolute horseshit:

Atton: You know women. Dark Jedi are bad enough, but when a woman falls to the Dark Side you better space yourself before they catch you. Uh, no offense or anything.

Then he immediately goes on to describe her as a ‚Äúhalf-naked‚Ä¶personal fantasy of mine‚Äù and I‚Äôm just like‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.you DO realize that she could either save your life or leave you to perish of starvation right now? There‚Äôs also the love triangle between him, the Exile and the Disciple. In which he literally STAKES HIS CLAIM to the Exile by saying that he ‚Äúnoticed her first.‚Äù You‚Äôre not a motherfucking old-timey prospector, Atton!!!!

I just gave him a lot of shit, but you know what? Atton‚Äôs pretty dang great. A solid dude, if a bit of a mess, and super funny. The last thing to know about Atton is that he canonically thinks about fucking to keep Kreia out of his head, and that‚Äôs incredible.

We‚Äôll be talking about my favorite companion for a considerable amount of time, but 2nd place definitely goes to Bao-Dur. I love his contemplative, gentle nature and how it belies the massive destruction that he enabled during the Mandalorian Wars. ALSO his voice actor, Roger Guenveur Smith, has the BEST VOICE. Bao-Dur ASMR anyone????

187 people on r/KOTORmemes agree with me!!!!!

Okay, enough fucking around. I‚Äôm mainly here to talk about Kreia and how she is, hands down, one of the most complex and fascinating characters I‚Äôve ever encountered in a video game. In my opinion, Kreia, Ravel Puzzlewell and Flemeth make up the triumvirate of incredibly well-written, morally grey older women in RPGS and I am here! for! it!
